metadata.Title: CVE-2017-13144 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description: In ImageMagick before 6.9.7-10, there is a crash (rather than a "width or height exceeds limit" error report) if the image dimensions are too large, as demonstrated by use of the mpc coder.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> 0085-Avoid-a-crash-in-mpc-coder.patch in unstable 0081-Avoid-a-crash-in-mpc-coder.patch in stretch 0297-CVE-2017-13144-Fix-application-crash-if-image-dimensions-are-too-large.patch in wheezy 0261-CVE-2017-13144.patch in jessie sbeattie> this fix introduced a regression in xenial and trusty (LP: #1793485) and was reverted for those releases in USN 3785-1

criterions.comment: imagemagick: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
